summary: This is an email chain from August 12, 2019, discussing the protocol for when the Office of the Inspector General (OIG) or other investigative bodies arrive at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York to interview staff. It emphasizes employee rights to union representation (Weingarten Rights) during such interviews, following the death of Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Local 3148
persons.context: The sender of the email reminding management to inform the local union when investigators arrive to interview employees, to ensure employee representation rights are upheld.

events.title: Email Regarding OIG Investigations at MCC NY
events.description: Email correspondence discussing the protocol for when the Office of the Inspector General (OIG), FBI, or US Attorney's Office arrives at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York to conduct interviews of staff.

events.title: Inquiry About OIG Presence at MCC
events.description: A prior email inquiry asking if the OIG would be at the institution conducting interviews of bargaining unit staff on that day, and reminding management of employee Weingarten Rights.

locations: MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
keyFacts: The email discusses investigations at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, likely in the immediate aftermath of Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019.
It references the arrival of the Office of the Inspector General (OIG), FBI, or the US Attorney's Office to conduct interviews of staff (bargaining unit employees).
The core subject is upholding employee 'Weingarten Rights,' which guarantee union representation during investigatory interviews that the employee reasonably believes could lead to discipline.
The communication highlights tension between management and the union (Local 3148) regarding proper procedure when federal investigators are present.
The document is dated August 12, 2019, two days after Epstein's death, placing it directly within the context of the investigations into the circumstances surrounding his death.
